body:
you may need to do a shift-reload because of changed styles sheets and 
javascript.
@tanghus this doesn't help. but thanks anyway. can you please remove my url's in your post? thanks.

sorry about the massive quoting :-p

can you empty your browser cache and try again? it looks very much like stale styles - which we should be able to handle somehow...? @bartv2 you're the cache meister, right? ;)

i think its no cache problem. in my opinion it's a rewrite-rule problem. because the file apps include the css via href="/index.php/apps/files/css/files.css", but if i try to open the files.css via the url i only see the ui.

so the stylesheet can't load.

please add information about your server environment. 
we have an issue template as well as described in contribution.md

you're faster than me @deepdiver1975 ;)
this sounds like an old issue...

now i tested it locally with xampp and it works almost. i only can't see any upload button:

![unbenannt2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2974196/152831/0fe5e496-75db-11e2-9396-9ef1c9a6e1c0.png)

the browser and owncloud log is empty.

sorry, i was busy at work.

no the installations are from the same source archive.

now i discovered crazy stuff: i displayed the regex from the if condition. on the working version it looks like this
```
#^/apps/(?p<app>[^/]+?)/(?p<file>.*.css)$#s
```
the broken version tries several regex:
```
#^/apps(?:/(?p<app>[^/]+?)(?:/(?p<file>.*.css))?)?)?$#s
#^/apps(?:/(?p<app>[^/]+?)/$#s
#^/apps/(?p<app>[^/]+?)(?:/(?p<file>.*.php))?$#s
```
in the first one, one opening bracket is missing. i did a reinstall from http://owncloud.org/releases/owncloud-5.0.0-alpha1.tar.bz2, but no change.

why do i have 2 different search pattern?

i discovered the problem. the problem is in the file /3rdparty/symfony/routing/symfony/component/routing/routecompiler.php.

in line 67 they use the inf constant. but the sunos has a bug and returned 0 for inf. so the next condition will crash.

any general solution approaches or should i fix it only in my code?
@bartv2 @sualko is this issue know upstream (symfony)? maybe we need to update the symphony routing component

also the newest version of symfony uses the inf constant, so the update is unneeded.

and the bug is in sunos, so the fix should be there and not in oc i think. 

for me a replacement of inf with php_int_max works fine.

> for me a replacement of inf with php_int_max works fine.

can you report this work around to symphony?
i assume they would be interested in this as well.

thx
i will write a issue to them.

> i will write a issue to them.

thanks a lot! much appreciated!
i'll keep this issue open as a reminder for us to update the symphony code.
please paste the issue ref here if possible!

i sent a pr to symfony, here the link:

https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/7269

we will see what happens.
@bartv2 can i ask you to pull in the upstream code into our 3rdparty repo? thx
